 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַקְרָב‎</span> **noun masculine** ==scorpion== (apparently quadriliteral; Late Hebrew ***id.***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***a‡rabu***</u></abbr>; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַקְרַבָּא‎</span>); **\*\***&lt; [**feminine**] as in Late Hebrew, Syriac, Mandaean, Arabic (Levy gives Talmud [Aramaic] as **masculine**, but are readings correct?), Nöldeke (privately). — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַקְרָב‎</span> [[Deut.8.15|Deut 8:15]] (collective; of wilderness), plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַקְרַבִּים‎</span> [[Ezek.2.6|Ezek 2:6]] (figurative of enemies); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִסַּר בָּע‎</span> [[1Kgs.12.11|1Kgs 12:11]]; [[1Kgs.12.14|1Kgs 12:14]] = [[2Chr.10.11|2Chr 10:11]]; [[2Chr.10.14|2Chr 10:14]], i.e. scourges with points, stings. — See also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַעֲלֵה עַקְרַבִּים‎</span>.
